alert.note: Alert for Granville; Vance (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 5:50PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Vance and northeastern Granville Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 549 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Clarksville, or 12 miles north of Henderson, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Stovall, Steele Creek Marina & Campground, Kerr Lake, Tungsten and John H Kerr Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
